```{r code}
#prepare data for binomial regression

tdata <- change

#create dummy variables

tdata$MHd <-ifelse(tdata$MH == "Yes", 1, 0) #make a dummy variable for mental health, with 1 equivalent to yes
tdata$PHd <- ifelse(tdata$PH == "Yes", 1, 0) #make a dummy variable for physical health, with 1 equivalent to yes
tdata$Beliefd <- ifelse(tdata$Belief == "Yes", 1, 0) #make a dummy variable for belief, with 1 equivalent to yes

#column names: change 

#carry out binomial regression

m1 <- glm(Beliefd ~ PHd, family = binomial, data = tdata) #regress impact of physical health

m2 <- glm(Beliefd ~ MHd, family = binomia, data = tdata) #regress impact of mental health

m3 <- glm(Beliefd ~ PHd + MHd, family = binomial, data = tdata) #regress impact of physical AND mental health


table(summary(m1)) # table for impact of physical health on belief 
table(summary(m2)) #table for impact of mental health on belief
table(summary(m3)) # table for impact of physical and mental health on belief

#interpretation - belief yes, they believe their condition will get worse, 

```


This analysis found that individuals with on-going health issues DO/DO NOT change believe their condition will get worse while waiting for treatment
